Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 08:24AM awhome wrote: I still remember the anxiety and stress associated with the waiting.  It really is the hardest part.  From the time I first found the mass, to the diagnostic mamogram I was kind of able to put it out of my mind because everyone tells you the odds are in your favor.  But once you get that first bad test result it becomes torture to have to wait for each subsequent test result.  In my case, the radiologist who did the core biopsy explained what it was that had them so concerned about the mass I found.  She was very reassuring, but I had a pretty good idea that the biopsy results wouldn't be good by the way everyone was so attentive to me.  So, as all of the other ladies here have said, don't worry if it takes extra time to get the results - in my experience only bad news comes quickly!  Also, regardless of the results, don't lose faith and hope - even if it is cancer, there are so many more women who are survivors because of the great treatments that are in existence now.  Each step of this journey you are now on is a new discovery and not all of it will be bad...
